About Us

  • Know more about the IndusInd Bank journey
  1. About Us

Our Company

IndusInd Bank is one of India's leading financial services brand. We are the preferred banking solutions provider and partner for approximately 39 million customers across the country, including individuals, large corporations, various government entities and PSUs. Our banking network spans 2984 branches/ Banking outlets and 2956 ATMs spread across India, covering 1,57,000 villages, and we also have representative offices in London, Dubai and Abu Dhabi. The Bank offers a wide range of products and services for individuals and corporates, including microfinance, personal loans, personal and commercial vehicle loans, credit cards and SME loans.

Our Vision

IndusInd Bank will be:

A relevant business and banking partner to its clients

Engaged with all our stakeholders and will deliver sustainable and compliant growth and returns

Customer-responsive, striving at all times to collaborate with clients in providing solutions for their banking needs

A forerunner in the marketplace in terms of productivity, technology, efficiency and profitability

A change agent for financial inclusion in India

An equal opportunity and preferred employer

Mission

We will consistently add value to all our stakeholders by enhancing the sustainability of the organisation and emerge as India's most convenient Bank with financial metrics amongst the best in the industry.

Our History

Established in 1994 by a platform conceived and promoted by Srichand P Hinduja along with members of Indian diaspora, the name ‘IndusInd Bank' was inspired by the Indus Valley Civilization - one of the greatest cultural example of a combination of innovation with sound business and trade practices. Over the years, we have grown ceaselessly and dynamically driven by a zeal to offer our customers banking services at par with the highest quality standards in the industry..

2023-2024
Milestone

June 2023 - All thirteen of IndusInd Bank’s PIONEER branches have been officially recognized by the United States Green Building Council (USGBC) through their LEED (Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design) certification program. The nine Platinum-certified branches are located in Mumbai, Chennai, Delhi, Bangalore and Pune, while the four Gold-certified branches are situated in Gurgaon, Kolkata, Jaipur and Chandigarh.

Milestone

June 2023 - IndusInd Bank was appointed as an authorized ‘Agency Bank’ by the Ministry of Finance, Madhya Pradesh State Government. This appointment enabled IndusInd Bank for online collection of State Government Revenue and Receipts such as GST and VAT, collection of stamp duty and pension amounts on behalf of the Madhya Pradesh state government.

Milestone

June 2023 - IndusInd Bank partnered with Wise on multi-partner Indus Fast Remit platform to offer low-cost and seamless online inward remittance to India.

Milestone

June 2023 - IndusInd Bank, as part of its CSR program ‘Institutions on Solar’, completed the installation of rooftop grid connected solar panels at Maharashtra Arogya Mandal’s Sane Guruji Arogya Kendra, Pune. The installation is a large scale grid solar Photovoltaic system of 100-kW of energy, that will generate nearly 1,40,000 units of electricity yearly, thereby reducing carbon emission by over 113 Metric Tonnes.

Milestone

August 2023 - IndusInd Bank and Tiger Fintech - a Bajaj Capital Group company, launched the IndusInd Bank Tiger Credit Card, a co-branded credit card powered by Visa.

Milestone

August 2023 - IndusInd Bank celebrated Onam by launching the NRI Homecoming Festival in Kerala, where branches were decorated and a host of initiatives were planned to welcome the NRIs.

Milestone

September 2023 - IndusInd Bank launched the ‘Virtual Commercial Credit Card', empowering corporates and travel agents for hassle-free cross-border paymentS

1994-1995BEGINNING
Milestones

Mr. Srichand P. Hinduja, a leading NRI businessman and head of the Hinduja Group, conceived the vision of IndusInd Bank.

Milestones

The Bank was formally inaugurated in April 1994 by Dr. Manmohan Singh, the then Finance Minister of India. The Bank began its operations with USD 35 million with the first branch being opened at Opera House, Mumbai.

Awards
  • Incorporated in 1994; Promoted by a group of Non Resident Indians. Started operations with INR 1000 mn capital

Know More

Sustainability

The Bank has adopted a comprehensive approach to improve its triple bottom line (i.e., People, Planet and Profit) performance by integrating sustainability considerations in its business practices, decision-making, operations and products. In line with the overall strategy, a centralized Sustainability unit works closely with various stakeholders in developing the ESG strategy for each department.

2023-2024
Milestone
June 2023 - All thirteen of IndusInd Bank’s PIONEER branches have been officially recognized by the United States Green Building Council (USGBC) through their LEED (Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design) certification program. The nine Platinum-certified branches are located in Mumbai, Chennai, Delhi, Bangalore and Pune, while the four Gold-certified branches are situated in Gurgaon, Kolkata, Jaipur and Chandigarh.
June 2023 - IndusInd Bank was appointed as an authorized ‘Agency Bank’ by the Ministry of Finance, Madhya Pradesh State Government. This appointment enabled IndusInd Bank for online collection of State Government Revenue and Receipts such as GST and VAT, collection of stamp duty and pension amounts on behalf of the Madhya Pradesh state government.
June 2023 - IndusInd Bank partnered with Wise on multi-partner Indus Fast Remit platform to offer low-cost and seamless online inward remittance to India.
June 2023 - IndusInd Bank, as part of its CSR program ‘Institutions on Solar’, completed the installation of rooftop grid connected solar panels at Maharashtra Arogya Mandal’s Sane Guruji Arogya Kendra, Pune. The installation is a large scale grid solar Photovoltaic system of 100-kW of energy, that will generate nearly 1,40,000 units of electricity yearly, thereby reducing carbon emission by over 113 Metric Tonnes.
August 2023 - IndusInd Bank and Tiger Fintech - a Bajaj Capital Group company, launched the IndusInd Bank Tiger Credit Card, a co-branded credit card powered by Visa.
August 2023 - IndusInd Bank celebrated Onam by launching the NRI Homecoming Festival in Kerala, where branches were decorated and a host of initiatives were planned to welcome the NRIs.
September 2023 - IndusInd Bank launched the ‘Virtual Commercial Credit Card', empowering corporates and travel agents for hassle-free cross-border paymentS
September 2023 - IndusInd Bank announced its multi-year global partnership with the International Cricket Council (ICC), starting from the ICC Men’s Cricket World Cup 2023. The Bank scaled up the Cricket World Cup experience by bringing cricket fans to #CheerForGreatness. launched the #CheerForGreatness campaign. The Bank also scored big with the Anthem Companion programme at the ICC Men’s Cricket World Cup 2023, where customers, employees and stakeholders were given the opportunity to get theirchildren to participate in the teams' walk out onto the field before the start of matches.
October 2023 - IndusInd Bank introduced ‘INDIE’, an innovative customer oriented digital banking app with multiple industry-first offerings
October 2023 - IndusInd Bank introduced a brand campaign for its new digital banking app ‘INDIE’ during the ongoing ICC Men’s Cricket World Cup 2023
October 2023 - IndusInd Bank announced a strategic collaboration with Viamericas for its re-launched Indus Fast Remit (IFR) platform
November 2023 - The Bank commemorated the festive season with the launch of a ‘Loan Mela’ for all, replete with comprehensive financial, credit & home loan offerings. The Bank also launched a special Loan Mela for two-wheelers, construction equipment and passenger vehicles
November 2023 - IndusInd Bank went live with the RuPay Credit Card on UPI with the launch of ‘IndusInd Bank Platinum RuPay Credit Card’, in collaboration with the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI).
November 2023 - IndusInd Bank associated with Indraprastha Gas Limited (IGL) to enable digital rupee transactions in Delhi NCR
December 2023 - IndusInd Bank launched the of IndusInd Bank eSvarna, India’s first Corporate Credit Card on RuPay network. The launch positioned the Bank as the first in the country to integrate UPI functionality with a Corporate Credit Card.
December 2023 - IndusInd Bank launched an industry-first community banking program for Diamond Cohorts with the ‘Indus Solitaire Program’.
January 2024 - IndusInd Bank and EazyDiner collaboratively launched the EazyDiner IndusInd Bank Platinum Credit Card.
January 2024 - The Bank launched the UPI- enabled ‘IndusInd Bank Samman RuPay Credit Card’, in collaboration with National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI).
February 2024 - IndusInd Bank and Bharat Financial Inclusion Limited (100% subsidiary of IndusInd Bank) signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the State Government of Uttar Pradesh to focus on livestock healthcare management and welfare in the Western Uttar Pradesh region through their social initiative, Bharat Sanjeevani Program
March 2024 - The Bank launched Indus PayWear, India's first All-in-One tokenizable and contactless payments wearables for both debit and credit cards.
April 2024 - IndusInd Bank announced the successful execution of RBI’s programmable CBDC pilot, being the first Bank.
